page.title: 04Industry Yesteryear
page.content: There has never been much industry in this area. Horticulture and agriculture take up much of the land. There used to be Bentley's brickworks in Longton but this closed in 1964. Farther back there were also two breweries in Longton and a jam producer. In the 1880's a cotton mill opened in Walmer Bridge. It was powered by the River Walmer. It was very noisy. It provided work for people from Longton and terraced houses and a school were built to cope with the increase in population. The mill closed in the 1930's and the land occupied by it was later used by Milburn Motors and as a depot by Caledonian Road Services. The site is now taken up by sheltered accommodation for the elderly,an ambulance station and two recently established commercial concerns.
